title: scgpt_cell_type_annotation
description: scGPT cell type annotation through decoding of cell embeddings.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression algorithm to use for the output h5mu file
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression algorithm to use for the output h5mu file.

obs_predicted_cell_type.description: Type: `string`, default: `predicted_cell_type`. The name of the adata
obs_predicted_cell_type.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `predicted_cell_type`. The name of the adata.obs column to write predicted cell types to.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The padding token used in the model
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The padding token used in the model.

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token.

max_seq_len.description: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data
max_seq_len.help_text: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data.

gene_name_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `gene_name`, example: `gene_name`. The name of the adata
gene_name_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `gene_name`, example: `gene_name`. The name of the adata.var column containing gene names.

batch_id_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `batch_id`. The name of the adata
batch_id_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `batch_id`. The name of the adata.obs column to write categorical batch ids to.

n_cls.description: Type: `integer`, default: `8`. The number of classes
n_cls.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `8`. The number of classes.

n_input_bins.description: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of input bins
n_input_bins.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of input bins.

dsbn.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to use domain-specific batch normalization
dsbn.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to use domain-specific batch normalization.

n_hvg.description: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for
n_hvg.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for.

var_gene_names.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata
var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata.var column containing gene names. When no gene_name_layer is provided, the .var index will be used.

binned_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `binned`. The name of the adata layer to write the binned data to
binned_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `binned`. The name of the adata layer to write the binned data to.

obs_batch_label.description: Type: `string`, default: `sample`. The name of the adata
obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `sample`. The name of the adata.obs column containing the batch labels.

seed.description: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation
seed.help_text: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation. If not specified, no seed is used.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample.

input_layer.description: Type: `string`. Mudata layer (key from layers) to use as input data for hvg subsetting and binning; if not specified, X is used
input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Mudata layer (key from layers) to use as input data for hvg subsetting and binning; if not specified, X is used.

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory.

model.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/source/best_model.pt`. The model file
model.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/source/best_model.pt`. The model file.

model_config.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/source/args.json`. The model configuration file
model_config.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/source/args.json`. The model configuration file.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
